Side Effects: such severe stinging & burning_ it nearly put me off eye drops for good
Comments: dr switched me to another similar drop called azarga. much much more comfortable.

Side Effects: Slight stinging/irritabilty in eyes shortly after administering.
Comments: I was taking Timoptic 1x/day and was switched to Cosopt 2x/day to try to get eye pressures lower than with the Timoptic.  I am doing MUCH better on the Cosopt than I was on the Timoptic_ as the beta-blocker ingredient seems to be less potent.  I am a runner_ and switching to Cosopt has helped me to be able to run faster and more effortlessly than when I was on the Timoptic. And so far my pressures are closer to where my eye doctor wants them to be.

Side Effects: Stinging upon administration of drops_ red_ itchy eyes_ slight headache_ allergic eyes
Comments: I took timoptic_ one of the ingredients in cosopt_ for 20 years without problems.  But my pressure was creeping up around 25-27_ so dr. tried adding the eye diuretic.  It was uncomfortable for me and didn't lower the pressure at all.  I do have sensitive eyes_ though_ apparently.  Timoptic alone (or generic timolol) never bothered me.

not a good experience with this drug..prescribed two times a day but only tolerable once a day and I skip a day if symptomatic. ...awful but doc would not change it. i wondered if preservatives were at fault but doc shot that down.

Side Effects: I developed corneal decompensation.  I was unable to read_ watch TV_ drive or do any of the things I usually do. This lasted for several months.
